context: The NES dropped the hardwired controllers, instead featuring two custom <a0_0><b4_0>7<b4_0/><a0_0/>-pin ports on the front of the console. Also in contrast to the Famicom, the controllers included with the NES were <a1_0><b5_0>identical<b5_0/><a1_0/> to each other—the second controller lacked the microphone that was present on the Famicom model and possessed the same START and SELECT buttons as the <a2_0><b6_0>primary controller<b6_0/><a2_0/>. Some NES localizations of games, such as The Legend of Zelda, which required the use of the <a3_0><b7_0>Famicom microphone<b7_0/><a3_0/> in order to kill certain enemies, suffered from the lack of hardware to do so.
